page.title: 19Travelling Fair
page.content: A travelling fair comes to Stand Road Park three or four times every year. The local children help the fairground people to build it up when it arrives and to take it down before they move on. All the children like the fair with its bright lights and very loud music. They don't seem to mind the mud or dust which they have to walk in to get to the various stalls where small prizes such as a goldfish can be won, for example, at darts or rolling small balls into numbered holes. There are little merry-go-rounds for the small children to ride on and, for the older ones, there are more exciting rides like the Waltzer which goes round and round at a fast speed, the Big Wheel which takes you high into the air, and Dodgems which test your skills as a driver. Also, you will find toffee apple, hot-dog & candy-floss stalls.
